question_content.barrons:question: By holding the balance of power in the sparsely settled borderlands between English and French settlements, and by their (i)________ to use their power against one or the other nation if not appropriately treated, the Iroquois played the game of European power politics with (ii)________.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
willingness; effectiveness.

It is easier to answer this question if you tackle the second blank first. If the Iroquois were holding the balance of power between the English and the French in the borderlands, then they were doing well in playing the game of European power politics. In fact, they were playing it with effectiveness. And what made them so effective was their willingness to use their power if they were not treated well.

Hesitancy is incorrect. They would not have done well at the game of power politics if they had shown any hesitancy (reluctance) about using their power.

Incapacity is incorrect. They would not have done well at the game of power politics if they had shown any incapacity (inability) to use their power.

Partiality is incorrect. The Iroquois felt free to use their power "against one or the other nation." They showed no partiality (bias or favoritism) in playing one side against the other.

Diversity is incorrect. Diversity (variety) makes no sense in the context.
